task.title: How to Use Two-Factor Authentication
task.shortdesc: Two-Factor Authentication is our way of making sure that your personal content is protected. We believe it is our first priority to make sure your property is safe.

context.p: Two-Factor Authentication is conducted by a free application called DuoMobile. You will need to download this application on your phone before you can access the Virginia Tech Network.

step.cmd: Once you have downloaded DuoMobile, you will be given the option to be sent a 6-digit pin number via email or text message. This pin number is your Virginia Tech Key that puts you in the system.
Once you've received the pin number, open up your DuoMobile application and copy/paste the pin number to your keychain.
Open a browser up on the Mac Desktop (or your laptop or phone) and when the Two-Factor Authentication window pops up, hit "send me a push".
Then open your email or phone, whichever notification option you selected, and click "accept".
The system may take a few seconds to process, and then you should be allowed onto the WiFi.

taskbody.postreq: If you are having trouble using DuoMobile, call the 24/7 tech support number: 143-666-4354
